content.user_title: Analyze whole-slide pathology images with PathML
content.value_statement: Computational pathology requires specialized knowledge of whole-slide imaging formats, stain normalization, and deep learning models. This skill provides expert guidance on using PathML for loading 160+ slide formats, preprocessing H&E images, building spatial tissue graphs, training nucleus segmentation models (HoVer-Net), and analyzing CODEX multiplex imaging data.
actual_capabilities: Load and process whole-slide images in 160+ proprietary formats (Aperio SVS, NDPI, DICOM, OME-TIFF)
Build preprocessing pipelines with stain normalization, tissue detection, and quality control transforms
Construct spatial cell and tissue graphs for neighborhood analysis and graph neural networks
Train and deploy deep learning models (HoVer-Net, HACTNet) for nucleus detection and classification
Analyze CODEX and Vectra multiplex immunofluorescence data with cell segmentation and marker quantification
Manage large pathology datasets with HDF5 storage, tile-based processing, and distributed computing
limitations: This skill provides guidance on using PathML - users must install the PathML library separately (uv pip install pathml)
Does not include pre-trained model weights - models download from external sources during use
GPU required for deep learning operations - CPU-only execution is significantly slower
Does not provide actual pathology images - users must supply their own slide data

use_cases.title: H&E image analysis
use_cases.description: Load H&E stained slides, apply stain normalization, detect nuclei, and extract features for downstream analysis

use_cases.title: Multiplex IF quantification
use_cases.description: Process CODEX or Vectra data, segment cells with Mesmer, and quantify marker expression per cell

use_cases.title: Train segmentation models
use_cases.description: Use PanNuke dataset to train HoVer-Net for nucleus instance segmentation and classification

prompt_templates.title: Load WSI file
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I load a whole-slide image in PathML? Show me how to load an Aperio SVS file, inspect its metadata, and generate tiles at level 1 for processing.

prompt_templates.title: Preprocess H&E
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PathML preprocessing pipeline for H&E stained tissue that includes: quality control to filter white space tiles, tissue detection, stain normalization using Macenko method, and nucleus detection.

prompt_templates.title: Build cell graph
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I construct a cell graph from segmented nuclei in PathML? I want to use KNN connectivity with k=6, extract morphological features, and export to PyTorch Geometric format for graph neural network training.

prompt_templates.title: CODEX analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the complete CODEX workflow in PathML: loading multi-cycle data, collapsing runs, segmenting cells with Mesmer using DAPI and CD45 channels, and quantifying marker expression for CD3, CD4, CD8, CD20 markers.

output_examples.input: How do I analyze a CODEX slide for immune cell composition?
output: Use SegmentMIF with nuclear_channel='DAPI' and cytoplasm_channel='CD45'
Run QuantifyMIF to extract marker expression per cell
Output is AnnData object with cells x markers matrix
Annotate cell types: T cells (CD3+), B cells (CD20+), macrophages (CD68+)
Visualize spatial distribution and run neighborhood enrichment analysis

best_practices: Apply stain normalization before color-sensitive operations to account for staining and scanner variations
Use GPU acceleration for deep learning transforms like SegmentMIF and model inference
Validate preprocessing on sample tiles before running batch processing on large datasets
anti_patterns: Do not process full-resolution images at level 0 for large WSI files - use level 1-2 for efficiency
Do not skip tissue detection before stain normalization - background artifacts distort stain estimation
Do not ignore quality control - remove white space and artifact tiles before expensive computations

faq.question: What slide formats does PathML support?
faq.answer: PathML supports 160+ formats including Aperio SVS, Hamamatsu NDPI, Leica SCN, Zeiss ZVI, 3DHISTECH MRXS, DICOM, OME-TIFF, and Vectra QPTIFF.

faq.question: What are the hardware requirements for deep learning?
faq.answer: GPU with CUDA support is recommended for SegmentMIF and model training. CPU-only processing works but is significantly slower for large datasets.

faq.question: Can I integrate PathML with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes - export to AnnData for scanpy, PyTorch Geometric for GNNs, ONNX Runtime for deployment, and HDF5 for efficient storage.

faq.question: Is patient data handled safely?
faq.answer: PathML processes images locally. No data is sent to external servers. Users are responsible for proper data handling and HIPAA compliance.

faq.question: Why is stain normalization important?
faq.answer: H&E slides vary in color due to staining protocols and scanners. Normalization ensures consistent color appearance for ML models and quantitative analysis.

faq.question: How does PathML compare to other tools?
faq.answer: PathML provides an integrated pipeline from image loading through ML training. Use with OpenSlide for format support, DeepCell for segmentation, and PyTorch for custom models.
